title: Blood Pigs (2010) indie post apocalypse zombie gore horror
description:
Blood Pigs (2010 - USA)

Horror
 
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2035465/


A Morbid Vision Films Production

Absolutely no CGI was used in the creation of Blood Pigs.

Blood Pigs voted "the goriest movie of 2010" in Rue Morgue magazine's readers poll.


The movie takes place in a post-apocalyptic setting. Something has happened that has left the world barren and empty. Well, mostly empty. Some of the dead have come back and are wreaking havoc, having evolved and taken to hiding rather than the typical stumbling and moaning. The survivors are few and far between and since animals and vegetation are a thing of the past, they have taken to eating the flesh of the undead. While it may be a bearable temporary solution, we can only imagine that the long-term effects will be damaging.

The story is a little bit confusing at times, and as it is shot on video, the picture is a little shaky and the sound is not consistent, with some sections of dialogue a bit hard to hear. Outside of these minor technicalities, Blood Pigs is pretty awesome, straight up fun. It has an original premise that follows through with what it promises and then some, and for an indie, WOW, there are some crazy effects in here.


Video: XviD, 608x336, 29.970 fps, 953 Kbps, 01h24m24s
Audio: Dolby AC3, 48000 Hz, stereo, 192 kbps

DVDRip, English audio, no subtitles

[the aspect ratio is a little squashed, use your player to expand the height]
